sen.e: On subsequent Hogen Disturbance, Yorimori joined the disturbance on the side of Emperor Goshirakawa since he was serving for Tadamichi and was appointed to the guard for the emperor with hundreds of roto (retainer) ("Heihanki" (diary of TAIRA no Nobunori), Article of August 5, 1156).

sen.e: On the other hand, his brother Yorinori joined the disturbance on the side of the retired Emperor Sutoku, but Yorimori on the emperor side won, so Yorinori on the retired emperor side was decapitated with his legitimate child.
